reasoning: Hypertensive heart failure is a specific subtype of heart failure secondary to uncontrolled hypertension. Global heart failure prevalence is 2-3% (~2000-3000 per 100k); hypertensive etiology accounts for approximately 30-40% of cases. Prevalence estimate ~800 per 100k based on WHO epidemiological data and clinical studies.
source: WHO Global Health Observatory and CDC cardiovascular epidemiology studies
